technology.name: Beasts of Zharr
technology.description: It's a risky business, as these beasts may not realise the fighting isn't real, but training with Lammasu and Tauruses improves their performance in battle no end.

effects.description: Armament cost: -10% for increasing capacity of Flying Monsters units
Weapon strength: +10% for all Lammasu, Great Taurus and Bale Taurus units
Number of uses: +1 for bound abilities on Lammasu and Bale Taurus units (Rank 7 and above)

technology.name: Total War!
technology.description: "The sport is war: Total War, when victory's a massacre."

effects.description: Maximum active Hell-Forge Forgecraft Options: +2

technology.name: Weapons of War
technology.description: The engineers and artificers of the Chaos Dwarf armies calibrate the really big guns in their arsenal for improved range and accuracy.

effects.description: Armament cost: -10% for increasing capacity of War Machine units
Passive ability: "Infernal Engineer" for Iron Daemon and Artillery units (Rank 7 and above)

enabled_if: Friendly War Machines or Artillery in range
Friendly War Machines or Artillery in range

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Skullcracker, Iron Daemon and Artillery units
Range: +5% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units

technology.name: Mass Sacrifices
technology.description: The Winds of Magic obey those willing to lay lives on the line to achieve their aims. Not their own lives, of course.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +20
	(all armies)

Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +10%
	(factionwide)

technology.name: Powers of the Conclave
technology.description: In the great Conclave of Evil, plans of domination are formulated and powers are seized to the cruellest of ends.

effects.description: Number of uses: +1 for abilities granted by the Tower of Zharr Seats and District rewards

technology.name: Labour Organisation
technology.description: Not all captives have equal worth as Labourers, but it takes experience to tell who’s worth shackling and where to send them.

effects.description:
Workload requirement for Raw Materials: -10%
	(all provinces)

Labour gained post-battle: +10%
	(all armies)

technology.name: Unilateral Agreements
technology.description: "All I see here is a signature and someone who hasn’t read the fine print."

effects.description: All Convoys gain an additional unit when completing Convoy route
Income from trade tariffs: +5% for every completed Convoy route

technology.name: Mighty Monsters
technology.description: Perfecting the husbandry of Lammasu and Tauruses makes for faster, hardier beasts that are harder for the foe to kill in battle.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Lammasu, Great Taurus and Bale Taurus units
Ward save: 5% for Lammasu, Great Taurus and Bale Taurus units

technology.name: Medical Supplies
technology.description: The Chaos Dwarfs’ forgecraft can also have convalescent applications, but such boons are only afforded to those chosen to drive their hosts forward.

effects.description:
Wound recovery time: -2
	(all characters)

Ward save: 5%
	(all characters)

technology.name: Weapons Depots
technology.description: From skull-splitting axes to flesh-shredding blunderbusses, the weapons surpluses of the Chaos Dwarfs sit ready for distribution.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2

Local recruitment capacity: +1
	(all provinces)

technology.name: Chosen by the Father
technology.description: Those whom the Father of Darkness has chosen gain great strength when fighting in his name.

effects.description:
Hit points: +5%
	(all characters)

Weapon strength: +10%
	(all characters)

technology.name: Continuous Bombardment
technology.description: "Hard pounding, Dhrath. Let's see who pounds the longest…"

effects.description: Explosive Missile Damage: +10% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
Ammunition: +10% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
Missile strength: +10% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units

technology.name: Shyish Bound
technology.description: Shyish brings about bodily mineralisation to Dawi-Zharr Sorcerers no slower than other lores, but those who use it pay the price gladly.

effects.description:
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Death spells
	(all armies)

Winds of Magic cost: -10% for Lore of Death spells
	(all armies)

technology.name: Imperishability Rituals
technology.description: The terrible Chaos magics gifted by Hashut can endow those he deems worthy with unnatural longevity and durability.

effects.description:
Immune to Desert attrition
	(all armies)

Immune to Swamp attrition
	(all armies)

technology.name: Conclave Dominance
technology.description: The Chaos Dwarf hierarchy rules through fear and cruelty. The ziggurats and towers of Zharr-Naggrund are the symbols of their mastery.

effects.description: Tower Settlement buildings gain an additional: +2 Conclave Influence per turn

Winds of Magic power reserve: +3 per turn
	(all armies)

technology.name: Aqshy Bound
technology.description: Mastery over the Lore of Fire can only bring the Dawi-Zharr's industrial goals, and the utter destruction of their hated foes, much closer to fruition.

effects.description:
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Fire spells
	(all armies)

Winds of Magic cost: -10% for Lore of Fire spells
	(all armies)

technology.name: Workforce Diktats
technology.description: Any method to reap more advantage from a Labourer than just the commodities they toil to provide should be undertaken without hesitation.

effects.description: Set an Example Labour action: additional Control +5
Sell Labour Labour action: additional  Treasury +750

technology.name: Increased Resource Allocation
technology.description: Hashut demands that he is honoured with fire, blood and spires that scrape the sky, the larger the fortress, the greater the monument to his greatness.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Tower settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Tower settlement buildings

technology.name: Arms Monopoly
technology.description: The secret to controlling the arms trade is to produce more and trade further afield than any of your rivals can.

effects.description: Sale value of cargo: +15%
Maximum Caravan cargo capacity: +15%

technology.name: Convoy Cartographers
technology.description: Mapping the terrain ensures future Convoys avoid the pitfalls, both figurative and literal, that have hindered their predecessors' progress.

effects.description: Chance of Caravan Ambush: -25%
Maximum number of active Convoys: +1

technology.name: Ammunition Caches
technology.description: Many such stores exist throughout the Dark Lands, and no single Dhrath-Zharr commander knows them all.

effects.description: Hero capacity: +1 for Infernal Castellan

Ammunition: +10%
	(all armies)

technology.name: Sacrificial Vats
technology.description: The bigger the receptacle of molten metal, the more screaming sacrifices that can be fed to it at once.

effects.description: Sacrifices for Zharr-Naggrund Labour action: additional  Conclave Influence +5

technology.name: Hashut Bound
technology.description: As the pact between the Chaos Dwarfs and their Dark God deepens, the tendrils of Hashut’s malevolence become one with their bitter souls.

effects.description:
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Hashut spells
	(all armies)

Winds of Magic cost: -10% for Lore of Hashut spells
	(all armies)

technology.name: Communing Altar
technology.description: An altar dedicated to Hashut grants his servants ancient knowledge, as well as the blessings of the Father of Darkness.

effects.description: Conclave Influence gained from all sources: +10%
Research rate: +10%

technology.name: Metallurgy
technology.description: The production, purification and manipulation of metals is a specialised science, that requires extensive knowledge of Chamon, the Lore of Metal.

effects.description:
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Metal spells
	(all armies)

Winds of Magic cost: -10% for Lore of Metal spells
	(all armies)

technology.name: Hashut Reverence
technology.description: Those loyal to the Dawi-Zharr recognise the hierarchy of their civilisation, with Hashut sitting alone atop it all, as a symbol of reverence.

effects.description: Temple of Hashut buildings gain an additional: +5 Conclave Influence per turn
Construction time: -1 for Temple of Hashut buildings

technology.name: Stockpiling
technology.description: The land’s surplus shall feed the Chaos Dwarf war machine, both in times of abundance and times of scarcity.

effects.description: Iron and Timber provides +15% Armaments output for province

technology.name: Resource Extractors
technology.description: The Chaos Dwarfs have become masters of trade and industry, as well as war, because they know which way total victory lies.

effects.description: Income from Gem and Gold Mines: +20%

technology.name: Temple Training
technology.description: Bull Centaur Renders, drilled in the Temple of Hashut and in sight of the Bull-God himself, fight harder and better for his infernal blessings.

effects.description: Armament cost: -10% for increasing capacity of Bull Centaur units
Attribute: Perfect Vigour for Bull Centaur Renders units (Rank 7 and above)
Melee attack: +5 for all Bull Centaur Renders units

technology.name: Alchemical Remedies
technology.description: Very, very unnatural remedies, to heal battle wounds swiftly and cleanly, ensure warriors can return to the front in peak condition as soon as is Dwarfly possible.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +5%

technology.name: Daemon Forges
technology.description: This is where the K'daai are 'born' of fire, and the darkest of dark magicks.

effects.description: Armament cost: -10% for increasing capacity of K'daai units
Enables "Flammable" attacks for K'daai units (Rank 7 and above), reducing fire resistance
Physical resistance: 10% for all K'daai units

technology.name: Architects’ Decrees
technology.description: Societal advancement is not possible unless the technocrats are given free rein.

effects.description: The Masterful Architects commandment: additional -10% construction cost
The Billowing Smoke Stacks commandment: additional +2 Control

technology.name: Tyrannical Decrees
technology.description: There’s no such thing as too many Labourers. The Overseers shall make work for their idle hands!

effects.description: The Higher Quotas commandment: additional +5% Armaments output
The Higher Quotas commandment: additional +5% income from Refinery buildings
The Military Doctrine commandment: additional +1 recruit rank

technology.name: Industrial Revolution
technology.description: Blood, sweat and corpses: the price to be paid for rapid and relentless progress.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Factory settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Factory settlement buildings

technology.name: Industrial Security
technology.description: Scheduled patrols of mines and factories give guards the lie of the land, ensuring more efficient protection of lucrative holdings.

effects.description: Campaign movement range from Tower Patrols buildings: +10%
Upkeep from Tower Patrols buildings : -5%

technology.name: Living Metal
technology.description: The warping taint to which the Bull Centaurs are subjected eventually leads to the hardening and distorting of their flesh, so that they appear to be made of living metal.

effects.description: Armour: +15 for Bull Centaur Renders units
Melee defence: +5  for Bull Centaur Renders units

technology.name: Reduced Rations
technology.description: An army may march on its stomach, but hungry troops fight with a greater urgency and brutality on the battlefield.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5%
	(all armies)

technology.name: Boiling Blood Sacrifices
technology.description: From such terrible events do wonderful things emerge. This is how the K'daai Zharr are made.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 for K'daai Fireborn units
Weapon strength: +10% for K'daai Destroyer units

technology.name: Mutual Benefits
technology.description: Not all Daemons must be bound to the Chaos Dwarfs' infernal engines – some simply hand over their lesser underlings, to the benefit of both parties.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +20 with Daemons of Chaos
Allied recruitment cost: -15%

technology.name: Ruinous Negotiations
technology.description: Selling weapons to Chaos' lesser followers means they can be tested in a live environment, and spreads word of the Chaos Dwarfs' dread machines far and wide.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +20 with Warriors of Chaos, Beastmen and Norsca

Chaos Undivided corruption: +1
	(all provinces)

technology.name: Hobgoblin Quartermasters
technology.description: Arming Hobgoblins is a risky business, but as long as they stay hated by other Greenskins they will stay loyal to you, more or less.

effects.description: Unit experience gain: +50% for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units
Leadership: +6 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units
Melee defence: +4 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units

technology.name: Varied Training
technology.description: Sometimes, the situation on the battlefield calls for a different approach. Therefore, units are trained to use a variety of arms and adapt to events as they unfold.

effects.description: Armament cost: -10% for increasing capacity of Melee and Missile Infantry units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Chaos Dwarf Infantry units
Recruit rank: +1 for Chaos Dwarf Infantry

technology.name: Signature Spellcasting
technology.description: Sorcerer-Prophets practice these signature spells extensively to prepare themselves for more difficult one that are easier to miscast… and with a greater risk of petrification!

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Spirit Leech"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Burning Wrath"

Miscast base chance: -15%
	(all characters)

technology.name: Malicious Compliance
technology.description: Increasing Labour capacity and, at the same time, breaking the spirit of the Labourers, is the sort of order any of the Chaos Dwarfs would happily carry out.

effects.description: Casualties captured post-battle: +10%

Control: +2
	(all provinces)

technology.name: Extended Shifts
technology.description: Such things would cost a small fortune in overtime, if indeed the Dawi-Zharr were paying their Labourers instead of exploiting them with menaces.

effects.description: Raw Materials output: +10%
Income from Scavenger buildings: 50

technology.name: Hotter Furnaces
technology.description: The red glow of a thousand diabolical furnaces intensifies, symbolising the Chaos Dwarfs’ growing industrial might.

effects.description: Income from Refinery buildings: +10%
Armaments output: +10%

technology.name: Overseer Organisation
technology.description: Left unsupervised, Labourers cannot be trusted.

effects.description: Maximum Caravan cargo capacity: +15%

technology.name: Siege Supplies
technology.description: Caches of food, weapons and munitions are kept because the perpetual aggressor can just as easily be forced into a defensive stance, and they intend to be ready for all eventualities.

effects.description:
Defensive supplies: +500
	(factionwide)
Attrition: -20% when under siege

technology.name: Mass Production
technology.description: Rearming armies is costly, but streamlining production techniques inevitably make things cheaper and quicker to make.

effects.description: Global recruitment duration: -1 turn(s) (minimum 1)

technology.name: Ceaseless March
technology.description: The pace is punishing, with no breaks and no slowing down. March or die!

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%

technology.name: Finest Leaders
technology.description: "Now we'll see what remains of this world. Only the strong will survive."

effects.description: Lord recruit rank: +2
Hero recruit rank: +2

technology.name: Envoys to the Conclave
technology.description: Embedding rivals' envoys within the Dawi-Zharr hierarchy increases the chances of diplomatic accord and cements allegiances when it really matters.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +15%
Diplomatic relations: +20 with Chaos Dwarfs

technology.name: Scorched Earth
technology.description: "If it isn't nailed down we take it. We can work out what to do with it all later. Burn the rest."

effects.description: Income from razing settlements: +10%
Income from sacking settlements: +10%

technology.name: Mandatory Service
technology.description: All Dhrath-Zharr should be ready for war, whenever the call to military service is sounded.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -10%
Global recruitment capacity: +1

technology.name: Roaming Round-ups
technology.description: "They won't get far. Unleash the wolves."

effects.description: Control: -2 in enemy provinces where an army is present
Income from raiding: +10%

technology.name: Smog Shroud
technology.description: The Chaos Dwarfs' factories leave the air thick with pollution. Though the Dawi move through it unhindered, foes struggle in the putrid air.

effects.description: Ambush success chance: +10%
Evasion chance when using the Underway: +15%

technology.name: Martial Training
technology.description: You can never drill too much, whether that be drilling for Hashut's Blood or drilling the Dawi-Zharr armed forces to brutal perfection.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1
Unit experience gain: +10%

technology.name: Tactical Review
technology.description: When the battle is over, the generals gather to consider what went well and what could be improved.

effects.description:
Battle reinforcement time: -25%
	(all armies)

Reinforcement range: +25%
	(all armies)

technology.name: Future of the Dawi-Zharr
technology.description: Today's Daemonsmiths are tomorrow's Sorcerer-Prophets. The more of them with experience of the Chaos Dwarfs' war machine there are, the stronger their forces will be.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance: +15%
Hero capacity: +1 for Daemonsmith Sorcerer

technology.name: Brazen Bodyguard
technology.description: Strength comes more naturally to those blessed with the image of the Father of Darkness himself.

effects.description: Hero action cost: -20%
Hero capacity: +1 for Bull Centaur Taur'ruk

technology.name: Wagon Engineering
technology.description: "You can’t just build it bigger, you wazzock! Such immense loads require an entirely different chassis altogether!"

effects.description: Obsidian and Marble provides +15% Raw Materials output for province

technology.name: Harbour Guilds
technology.description: This union of specialist builders, working together with common aims, means ports will be built faster and for the best possible price.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Ports
Construction time: -1 for Ports

technology.name: Veteran Convoy Master
technology.description: Trucking across the world on a Convoy is a life suited only to the hardiest Dawi, and the more experienced they are, the better.

effects.description: Experience per turn: +100 for Convoy Overseers

Lord recruit rank: +3 for Convoy Overseer
	(factionwide)

technology.name: Siege Logistics
technology.description: The Dawi-Zharr’s natural proficiency in logistics gets the most out of their armouries and quartermasters when it is needed the most.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 when under siege
Ammunition: +20% when under siege

technology.name: Pandemic Preparations
technology.description: There is always work to do. Sickness is a weakness of the industrial machine.

effects.description: Chance of a plague spreading: -25%
Chaos Undivided corruption from Protection buildings: +2

technology.name: Starved Wolves
technology.description: A very hungry wild animal moves quicker and savages their prey with greatly increased vigour.

effects.description: Speed: +5% for Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units
Charge bonus: +10 for Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units

technology.name: Stronghold Syndrome
technology.description: Extended time spent on the Plains of Zharr has led these Labourers to fully believe in their overlords' objectives, and are now seeking to prove their loyalty in battle.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Labourers and Hobgoblin Infantry units
Melee attack: +4 for Labourers and Hobgoblin Infantry units

technology.name: The Call to War
technology.description: The call has come: it's war! Those who honour Hashut shall receive his infernal blessing.

effects.description: Leadership: +6 for Chaos Dwarf melee infantry units
Melee defence: +4 for Chaos Dwarf melee infantry units

technology.name: Hollow Rounds
technology.description: A high-velocity bullet at close range can damage the mind: shattering the skull, shredding the brain, severing the spine.

effects.description: Missile strength: +8% for Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses and Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) units
Reload time reduction: +6% for Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses and Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) units

technology.name: Tallest Towers
technology.description: Reaching high above the putrid smog clouds, these spires are a symbol of Dawi-Zharr authority and a required vantage point.

effects.description: Campaign line of sight: +15% for settlements

Control: +1
	(all provinces)

technology.name: Applied Assignments
technology.description: Since Goblins and their ilk are notably weaker than their larger Orcish cousins, it makes sense to assign the heavy duty tasks to them, which in turn keeps "workplace incidents" down…

effects.description: Rush Construction Labour cost: -10%
Construction cost: -5% for all buildings

technology.name: Live to Work, Work to Live
technology.description: If the Labourers don't build outposts quickly, they will have nowhere to sleep – so no rest until it's done!

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Outpost settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Outpost settlement buildings

technology.name: Labour Quotas
technology.description: Quotas must be met. If it's got a pulse, get it onto the production line.

effects.description:
Labour gained post-battle: +5%
	(all armies)

technology.name: Merchant Guilds
technology.description: When it comes to matters of trade, guilds are an ingenious device for increasing profits without individual responsibility.

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +10%
Tradable resources produced: +10%

technology.name: Wartime Economy
technology.description: Resources prioritised and mobilised for the sole purpose of war ensure military supremacy is maintained.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Basic and Advanced Military buildings
Construction time: -1 for Basic and Advanced Military buildings

technology.name: Territorial Consignments
technology.description: No empire survives this long in the Dark Lands without paying heed to its regions' individual defence needs.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Defence buildings
Construction time: -1 for Defence buildings

technology.name: Reach 12 unit capacity for Warmachines to unlock second carriage
technology.description: HIDDEN

effects.description: Unlocks a third carriage slot for your Iron Daemon or Skull Cracker

technology.name: Reach 10 unit capacity for Warmachines to unlock second carriage
technology.description: HIDDEN

effects.description: Unlocks a second carriage slot for your Iron Daemon or Skull Cracker
